trans-unit.source: Represents the status of an application's network connection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ConnectivityStatus> class to specify the network connectivity of Windows-based applications that use client application services.

When you set the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ConnectivityStatus.IsOffline%2A> property to `true`, the client service providers use the offline cache instead of attempting to access the corresponding Web services.
The offline status is stored on a per-user and per-application basis.
For more information, see [How to: Work Offline with Client Application Services](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f792cb16-8520-4a0f-9dc9-07bfbc454e38).
Gets or sets a value indicating whether an application is in offline mode.
When you set the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ConnectivityStatus.IsOffline%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ConnectivityStatus> class caches the value to the local file system.

The client service providers in the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers> namespace check this value to determine whether to use the offline data cache instead of attempting to access the associated [!INCLUDE[ajax_current_short](~/includes/ajax-current-short-md.md)] authentication, roles, and profile services.
`true` if the application is in offline mode; otherwise, `false`.
